item.value: Command line prompt configuration value. Other hiveconf can be used in this configuration value. \n" + "Variable substitution will only be invoked at the Hive CLI startup
// Remember all threads that were running at the time we started line processing. // Hook up the custom Ctrl+C handler while processing this line
hive Variable Source
Compile a new query, but potentially reset taskID counter. Not resetting task counter * is useful for generating re-entrant QL queries.
/*It's imperative that {@code acquireLocks()} is called for all commands so that HiveTxnManager can transition its state machine correctly*/
the sinks and DDL cannot coexist at this time; but if they could we would // need to make sure we don't get two write IDs for the same table

it's possible to have > 1 FileSink writing to the same table/partition * e.g. Merge stmt, multi-insert stmt when mixing DP and SP writes * Insert ... Select ... Union All Select ... using * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.AbstractFileMergeOperator#UNION_SUDBIR_PREFIX} */
//sorting makes tests easier to write since file names and ROW__IDs depend on statementId //so this makes (file name -> data) mapping stable
Set the table write id in all of the acid file sinks

Acquire read and write locks needed by the statement. The list of objects to be locked are * obtained from the inputs and outputs populated by the compiler. Locking strategy depends on * HiveTxnManager and HiveLockManager configured
the sinks and DDL cannot coexist at this time; but if they could we would // need to make sure we don't get two write IDs for the same table.
does not add back up task here, because back up task should be the same // type of the original task
Lock operations themselves don't require the lock.
Concurrency mode is disabled, not creating a lock manager
Assumes the query has already been compiled
the release here will do nothing because there is no lock
since set autocommit starts an implicit txn, close it
Lock acquisition should be moved before analyze, this is a bit hackish.

Currently, we acquire a snapshot, we compile the query wrt that snapshot, // and then, we acquire locks. If snapshot is still valid, we continue as usual. // But if snapshot is not valid, we recompile the query.
Snapshot was outdated when locks were acquired, hence regenerate context, // txn list and retry

Checks whether txn list has been invalidated while planning the query. // This would happen if query requires exclusive/semi-shared lock, and there // has been a committed transaction on the table over which the lock is // required.
Trigger query hooks after query completes its execution.
// compile and execute can get called from different threads in case of HS2 // so clear timing in this thread's Hive object before proceeding.
// Snapshot was outdated when locks were acquired, hence regenerate context, // txn list and retry
Since we're reusing the compiled plan, we need to update its start time for current run

// deferClose indicates if the close/destroy should be deferred when the process has been // interrupted, it should be set to true if the compile is called within another method like // runInternal, which defers the close to the called in that method.
compile internal will automatically reset the perf logger
Command Processor Response

Here we want to encode the error in machine readable way (e.g. JSON) * Ideally, errorCode would always be set to a canonical error defined in ErrorMsg. * In practice that is rarely the case, so the messy logic below tries to tease * out canonical error code if it can. Exclude stack trace from output when * the error is a specific/expected one. * It's written to stdout for backward compatibility (WebHCat consumes it)
Enables to use re-execution logics
Let Driver strip comments using sql parser
// Start the session in a fire-and-forget manner. When the asynchronously initialized parts of // the session are needed, the corresponding getters and other methods will wait as needed
Compile a new query. Any currently-planned query associated with this Driver is discarded. * Do not reset id for inner queries(index, etc). Task ids are used for task identity check
Both UDF and UDAF functions can imply order for analytical functions
Validate the function name
SHOW FUNCTIONS is deprecated, please use SHOW FUNCTIONS LIKE instead.
Try qualifying with current db name for permanent functions
First try without qualifiers - would resolve builtin/temp functions
Missing over clause for function
Looks up the function name in the registry. If enabled, will attempt to search the metastore * for the function.
